column4: hi guys, still trying to find some detailed documentation for apache on ubuntu (fiesty fawn), any suggestions?
install on the other comp ( it's only 30 min anyway ) then just copy over your home folder
you can make a simple  bash script with  apt-get install for that
if you insist on cloning   manpage   dd
basicaly you can script any proceedure you had to do with the terminal
much of the basic progs are on the cd to begin with , and donT' have to be downloaded
just run a update after putting the cd in so it notices the packages are there ,  there are even more on the dvd , saves a lot of bandwith
basicaly the cd is being used as a nother repos,  and apt will just used the latest version ofhte package it can find,  if it is on the cd it will use that one first
same as the cd it's jsut the dvd instead,  it has everyting on it,  live,  alternate, server, ,  sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get update then  run the install command again
do not edit your sources list , you donT' need to  just update
I know there have been issues with SATA HDD but I haven'T expericed it myself and I have two WDC hdd one sata one IDe
I donT' know, try locate apache
I've asked and never got an answer
